title: Zelensky Pushes Ahead With Cabinet Overhaul
content: President Volodymyr Zelensky’s party announced a slate of nine candidates for cabinet posts on Wednesday, marking the biggest shake-up in the  government since the war against Russia started.
summary: President Volodymyr Zelensky’s party announced a slate of nine candidates for cabinet posts on Wednesday, marking the biggest shake-up in the  government since the war against Russia started.

title: Poltava Strike Aftermath Drains Ukraine’s Seasoned Rescuers
content: Repeated air-raid alerts have punctuated the search through the rubble in Poltava, in eastern Ukraine, after an attack that killed more than 50 people.
summary: Repeated air-raid alerts have punctuated the search through the rubble in Poltava, in eastern Ukraine, after an attack that killed more than 50 people.

title: With New Taliban Manifesto, Afghan Women Fear the Worst
content: Three years into its rule, the movement has codified its harsh Islamic decrees into law that now includes a ban on women’s voices in public.
summary: Three years into its rule, the movement has codified its harsh Islamic decrees into law that now includes a ban on women’s voices in public.

title: Cease-Fire Talks Present Tough Choices for Gazans Devastated by War
content: Some say they will reluctantly stomach a postwar Israeli military presence in the territory if that allows them to go home. Others worry about another long-term occupation.

title: 4 Takeaways From the U.K. Grenfell Tower Fire Report
content: An extensive public inquiry found that the causes of the Grenfell Tower tragedy stretched back decades, and that the deaths of 72 people were avoidable.

title: Trudeau’s Hold On Power Slips After Collapse of Liberal Party Agreement

summary: A left-leaning party that helped Canada’s Liberals build a majority in Parliament announced it was ending its support, making it possible an election is called early.

title: Damning Final Report Into Deadly Grenfell Fire Is Released
content: A damning final report into Britain’s worst residential fire since World War II blamed a litany of cost-cutting, dishonest sales practices and lax regulation for the blaze that killed 72 people.
summary: A damning final report into Britain’s worst residential fire since World War II blamed a litany of cost-cutting, dishonest sales practices and lax regulation for the blaze that killed 72 people.

title: Hounded From a Beauty Pageant in South Africa, Then Crowned in Nigeria

title: Mexico’s Lower House of Congress Approves President’s Judicial Overhaul
content: The vote was the first step toward shifting the country to a system in which nearly every judge would be elected to office. The bill now moves to the Senate.

title: Pope Praises Indonesia’s ‘Delicate Balance’ Within Diversity

title: Russia Imprisons Top Physicists, Even as Putin Touts Their Technology

title: Short Notice and Blocked Exits Proved Lethal in Strike in Ukraine
